body.p: The St. John Baptist Society, at its meeting held on December 8 in the St. George Parish Hall, donated one hundred dollars from its treasury to the cause of Lithuanian independence.
Afterwards, the members present decided that the amount was not large enough, so they donated twenty-nine dollars more.
The donors were as follows: [Editor's note: There follows a long list of contributors] The grand total, including the donation from the treasury, was $129.
The money has been turned over to Lietuva, which will send it to the Lithuanian Independence Fund.

A suggestion was made at the meeting that the members be assessed fifty cents
a month for the Lithuanian cause. There was also a motion that the Society pay a weekly sick benefit of $7.50 to its members. These matters were left open for discussion at the annual meeting.

The following were elected to office for the next year: J. Eringis, president, P. Pocevicius, vice-president, George Sereika, recording secretary,
M. Barauskas, financial secretary, and John Zilvitis, treasurer.

Mr. Zilvitis has held the office of treasurer for twelve years. The society
is financially sound.
